tuv.seg: Case study: Calculating deferrals of Local Property Tax (LPT)
Cás-staidéar: Iarchur Cáin Mhaoine Áitiúil (CMÁ) a Dheimhniú
Example 1: Couple (no outstanding mortgage) who qualify for full deferral
Sampla 1: Lánúin (morgáiste ar bith gan íoc) a cháilítear le haghaidh iarchur iomlán
Seán and Eileen are married and owner-occupiers
Tá Seán agus Eibhlín pósta agus is úinéirí lonnaitheacha iad
They have calculated that their LPT liability for 2015 is €405
Rinne siad a ríomh gurb ionann a ndliteanas don CMÁ le haghaidh 2015 agus €405
Their estimated gross income for 2014 is €23,000
Is ionann a n-ollioncam measta le haghaidh 2014 agus €23,000
They are under the limit (€25,000) to qualify for a full deferral so they can decide to opt for a full deferral of their LPT liability
Má dhéanann siad an cinneadh chun iarchur iomlán a fháil i leith a ndliteanais CMÁ, ba cheart dóibh rogha an iarchuir iomláin a roghnú ar a dtuairisceán CMÁ
A charge for the deferred amount, including interest, will be placed on the property
Gearrfar muirear ar an méid iarchurtha, lena n-áirítear ús, ar an maoin
Example 2: Single person (no outstanding mortgage) who qualifies for partial deferral
Sampla 2: Duine singil (morgáiste ar bith gan íoc) a cháilítear le haghaidh iarchur páirteach
Emma is single and an owner-occupier
Bean shingil í Emma agus is úinéir lonnaitheach í
She has calculated that her LPT liability for 2015 is €315
Ríomh sí gurb ionann a dliteanas CMÁ le haghaidh 2015 agus €315
Her estimated gross income for 2014 is €18,000
B’ionann a hollioncam measta le haghaidh 2014 agus €18,000
Therefore her gross income is over the limit (€15,000) to qualify for a full deferral but under the limit (€25,000) to qualify for a partial (50%) deferral
Ar an ábhar sin, sáraíonn a hollioncam an teorainn (€15,000) chun cáiliú le haghaidh iarchur iomlán, ach tá sé faoin teorainn (€25,000) chun cáiliú d’iarchur páirteach (50%)
If Emma decides to opt for a partial deferral she must confirm which payment option she will use to pay the balance of her LPT (€157.50)

Má dhéanann Emma an cinneadh chun iarchur páirteach a dliteanais CMÁ a fháil, ba cheart di rogha an iarchuir pháirtigh a roghnú ar a tuairisceán CMÁ agus a dheimhniú cén rogha íocaíochta a úsáidfidh sí chun iarmhéid a CMÁ (€157.50) a íoc
A charge for the deferred amount, including interest, will be placed on the property
Gearrfar muirear ar an méid iarchurtha, lena n-áirítear ús, ar an maoin
Example 3: Single person (with mortgage) who qualifies for partial deferral
Sampla 3: Duine singil (a bhfuil morgáiste acu) a cháilítear le haghaidh iarchur páirteach
Ross is single and an owner-occupier
Fear singil é Ross agus is úinéir lonnaitheach é
He has calculated that his LPT liability for 2015 is €202
Ríomh sé gurb ionann a dhliteanas CMÁ le haghaidh 2015 agus €202
His estimated gross income for 2014 is €27,000 and his anticipated gross mortgage interest for 2014 is €6,000
Is ionann a ollioncam measta le haghaidh 2014 agus €27,000 agus is ionann a ollús morgáiste le haghaidh 2014 agus €6,000
To qualify for a full deferral Ross’s gross income must not exceed €15,000 plus 80% of his gross mortgage interest:
Chun cáiliú d’iarchur iomlán, níor cheart go sáródh ollioncam Ross €15,000 móide 80% dá ollús morgáiste
Gross income threshold: €15,000 + 80% of Ross’s gross mortgage interest (80% of €6,000): € 4,800
Tairseach ollioncaim: €15,000 + 80% d’ollús morgáiste Ross (80% de €6,000): €4,800
Ross’s adjusted income threshold for full deferral = €19,800
Tairseach choigeartaithe ioncaim Ross le haghaidh iarchur iomlán = €19,800
As Ross’s gross income (€27,000) is greater than his full deferral adjusted income threshold (€19,800) he does not qualify for a full deferral
Mar gheall go sáraíonn ollioncam Ross (€27,000) a thairseach choigeartaithe le haghaidh iarchur iomlán (€19,800), ní cháilítear é d’iarchur iomlán
However, he may qualify for a partial deferral
Ach b’fhéidir go gcáileofaí é le haghaidh iarchur páirteach
To qualify for a partial deferral Ross’s gross income must not exceed €25,000 plus 80% of his gross mortgage interest:
Chun cáiliú d’iarchur páirteach, níor cheart go sáródh ollioncam Ross €25,000 móide 80% dá ollús morgáiste:
Gross income threshold: €25,000 + 80% of Ross’s gross mortgage interest (80% of €6,000): €4,800
Tairseach ollioncaim: €25,000 + 80% d’ollús morgáiste Ross (80% de €6,000): €4,800
Ross’s adjusted income threshold for partial deferral = €29,800
Tairseach choigeartaithe ioncaim Ross le haghaidh iarchur páirteach = €29,800
As Ross’s gross income (€27,000) is less than his partial deferral adjusted income threshold (€29,800) he qualifies for a partial (50%) deferral
Mar gheall nach sáraíonn ollioncam Ross (€27,000) a thairseach choigeartaithe le haghaidh iarchur páirteach (€29,800), cáilítear é d’iarchur páirteach
